quest.title: Because Mr. Chang has been busy these days, it's ________ whether he will come to the party.
I'm quite ________ to the weather in Taiwan, so I think I'll stay here for another year.
Mr. Smith won't tolerate talking during class; he says it ________ others.
On the basis of the clues, can you predict the ________ of the story?
A good reader can often figure out what new words mean by using ________.
I sometimes take John's coat for my own, because the two of them look so ________.
George at first had difficulty swimming across the pool, but he finally succeeded on his fourth ________.
With her teachers’ and parents’ ________, Jane regained her confidence and has made great progress.
One of Jane’s finest qualities is that she takes the ________. She always takes the necessary action and does not wait for orders.
Mr. Li is a senior ________ at a local bank. He keeps and examines financial records of people and companies.
Chinese parents are usually very ________ of their children. They want to make sure their children are safe and well taken care of all the time.
On receiving my letter of complaint, the hotel manager sent me a written ________.
I wonder why she ________ turned up the radio when I was studying.
It suddenly ________ me that I had to get to the airport to meet a friend.
Being a very careful person, he is quite ________ in giving his comments.
Most viewers agreed that the movie ________ was not as good as the book.
The native greeted the travelers in a ________ language which was strange to them.
Several motorists were ________ waiting for the light to change.
Mary wrote a letter of ________ to the manufacturer after her new car broke down three times in the same week.
John's poor math score must have ________ him a lot, because he is not attending the class any more.
The issue of environmental protection has not received much attention until very ________.
The old man could ________ swallow because his throat was too dry.
We are more than willing to ________ our ties with those countries that are friendly to us.
The artist is famous for his genius and great ________.
Although some things are ________, they nevertheless exist.
The main ________ of this test is to find out how much you have learned in high school.
I hope to live in a student dormitory when I am in college.  I am tired of ________ to school in a crowded bus every day.
They were behind schedule and had to apply for ________ manpower to complete their project in time.
Out of ________ and consideration, I always write a thank-you note when someone sends me a gift.
The boy ________ to the teacher for his improper behavior.
The problem with Jane is that she tends to take criticism too ________ and gets angry easily.
Almost everybody is a ________ of many different 'selves'; we show different faces to different people.
John has been working at the computer for twenty-four hours.  He ________ needs a good rest.
Nowadays students can ________ information from a variety of sources, such as computers, television, and compact discs.
Sorry for being late.  Someone gave me ________ directions and I got totally lost.
Jack doesn’t look ________, but he is, in fact, excellent at sports, especially baseball.
What a small computer!  Does it really ________?
For your own ________, please don't open the door until the train fully stops.
Peter told Marie that he couldn't attend her birthday party because he had been ________ engaged.
For hours, we have heard nothing but negative criticism.  Why can't you say something more ________?
This library is famous for its wide ________ of books.  You can find books on any topic you are interested in.
The child was ________.  He just sat there and waited for something to happen.
Lost and scared, the little dog ________ along the streets, looking for its master.
On a sunny afternoon last month, we all took off our shoes and walked on the grass with ________ feet.
It is both legally and ________ wrong to spread rumors about other people on the Internet.
These warm-up exercises are designed to help people ________ their muscles and prevent injuries.
Mei-ling has a very close relationship with her parents. She always ________ them before she makes important decisions.
The restaurant has a ________ charge of NT$250 per person. So the four of us need to pay at least NT$1,000 to eat there.
At the Book Fair, exhibitors from 21 countries will ________ textbooks, novels, and comic books.
Before John got on the stage to give the speech, he took a deep ________ to calm himself down.
Most young people in Taiwan are not satisfied with a high school ________ and continue to pursue further education in college.
Residents are told not to dump all household waste ________ into the trash can; reusable materials should first be sorted out and recycled.
Kevin had been standing on a ladder trying to reach for a book on the top shelf when he lost his ________ and fell to the ground.
If student enrollment continues to drop, some programs at the university may be ________ to reduce the operation costs.
People in that remote village feed themselves by hunting and engaging in ________ forms of agriculture. No modern agricultural methods are used.
The government issued a travel ________ for Taiwanese in response to the outbreak of civil war in Syria.
The baby panda Yuan Zai at the Taipei Zoo was separated from her mother because of a minor injury that occurred during her birth. She was ________ by zookeepers for a while.
Many people think cotton is the most comfortable ________ to wear in hot weather.
Because of the engine problem in the new vans, the auto company decided to ________ them from the market.
After a day’s tiring work, Peter walked ________ back to his house, hungry and sleepy.
In team sports, how all members work as a group is more important than how they perform ________.
Despite her physical disability, the young blind pianist managed to overcome all ________ to win the first prize in the international contest.
Each of the planets in the solar system circles around the sun in its own ________, and this prevents them from colliding with each other.
Professor Wang is well known for his contributions to the field of economics. He has been ________ to help the government with its financial reform programs.
Most earthquakes are too small to be noticed; they can only be detected by ________ instruments.
With Wikileaks releasing secrets about governments around the world, many countries are worried that their national security information might be ________.
I’m afraid we can’t take your word, for the evidence we’ve collected so far is not ________ with what you said.
The traffic on Main Street was ________ for several hours due to a car accident in which six people were injured.
Hundreds of people ________ in the desert storm and many more were left homeless.
Mike arrived at the meeting ________ at ten o’clock — as it was scheduled — not a minute early or late.
A power failure ________ darkened the whole city, and it was not until two hours later that electricity was restored.
Sam couldn’t ________ how to print out the document until the teacher showed it to him.
Jordan’s performance ________ his teammates and they finally beat their opponents to win the championship.
Mr. Lin’s comments were very difficult to follow because they were ________ related to the topic under discussion.
Jack came from a poor family, so his parents had to ________ many things to pay for his education.
The ________ of SARS has caused great inconvenience to many families in Taiwan.
Victor’s classmates are very ________ of him because he has just received a new cell phone for his birthday.
Some people still believe, quite ________, that one can get AIDS by shaking hands with homosexuals.
There are altogether 154 foreign students in this university, ________ a total of thirteen different countries.
During a ________, many people become unemployed and very few new jobs are available.
Chinese is a language with many ________ differences. People living in different areas often speak different dialects.
A menu serves to ________ customers about the varieties and prices of the dishes offered by the restaurant.
Mary and Jane often fight over which radio station to listen to. Their ________ arises mainly from their different tastes in music.
The baby polar bear is being ________ studied by the scientists. Every move he makes is carefully observed and documented.
At twelve, Catherine has won several first prizes in international art competitions. Her talent and skills are ________ for her age.
After his superb performance, the musician received a big round of ________ from the appreciative audience.
The mirror slipped out of the little girl’s hand, and the broken pieces ________ all over the floor.
No one knows how the fire broke out. The police have started an ________ into the cause of it.
When there is a heavy rain, you have to drive very ________ so as to avoid traffic accidents.
We decided to buy some ________ for our new apartment, including a refrigerator, a vacuum cleaner, and a dishwasher.
This math class is very ________; I have to spend at least two hours every day doing the assignments.
One can generally judge the quality of eggs with the naked eye. ________, good eggs must be clean, free of cracks, and smooth-shelled.
The scientist ________ his speech to make it easier for children to understand the threat of global warming.
The Internet has ________ newspapers as a medium of mass communication. It has become the main source for national and international news for people.
The new stadium was built at a convenient ________, close to an MRT station and within walking distance to a popular shopping center.
The young Taiwanese pianist performed ________ well and won the first prize in the music contest.
As thousands of new ________ from Southeastern Asia have moved to Taiwan for work or marriage, we should try our best to help them adjust to our society.
Although the manager apologized many times for his poor decision, there was nothing he could do to ________ his mistake.
Last winter’s snowstorms and freezing temperatures were quite ________ for this region where warm and short winters are typical.
To overcome budget shortages, some small schools in rural areas have set up ________ programs to share their teaching and library resources.
After spending much time carefully studying the patient’s ________, the doctor finally made his diagnosis.
The universe is full of wonders. Throughout history, people have been ________ by the mystery of what lies beyond our planet.
The president’s speech will be broadcast ________ on television and radio so that more people can listen to it at the time when it is delivered.
In order to expand its foreign market, the company decided to ________ its products and provide more varieties to the customer.
It rained so hard yesterday that the baseball game had to be ________ until next Saturday.
As more people rely on the Internet for information, it has ________ newspapers as the most important source of news.
Having saved enough money, Joy ________ two trips for this summer vacation, one to France and the other to Australia.
Since I do not fully understand your proposal, I am not in the position to make any ________ on it.
Betty was ________ to accept her friend’s suggestion because she thought she could come up with a better idea herself.
The bank tries its best to attract more customers. Its staff members are always available to provide ________ service.
John’s part-time experience at the cafeteria is good ________ for running his own restaurant.
Women’s fashions are ________ changing: One season they may favor pantsuits, but the next season they may prefer miniskirts.
Standing on the seashore, we saw a ________ of seagulls flying over the ocean before they glided down and settled on the water.
The book is not only informative but also ________, making me laugh and feel relaxed while reading it.
After working in front of my computer for the entire day, my neck and shoulders got so ________ that I couldn’t even turn my head.
Getting a flu shot before the start of flu season gives our body a chance to build up protection against the ________ that could make us sick.
The kingdom began to ________ after the death of its ruler, and was soon taken over by a neighboring country.
Though Kevin failed in last year’s singing contest, he did not feel ________. This year he practiced day and night and finally won first place in the competition.
Emma and Joe are looking for a live-in babysitter for their three-year-old twins, ________ one who knows how to cook.
The ending of the movie did not come as a ________ to John because he had already read the novel that the movie was based on.
In order to stay healthy and fit, John exercises ________. He works out twice a week in a gym.
Traveling is a good way for us to ________ different cultures and broaden our horizons.
The story about Hou-I shooting down nine suns is a well-known Chinese ________, but it may not be a true historical event.
According to recent research, children under the age of 12 are generally not ________ enough to recognize risk and deal with dangerous situations.
Helen let out a sigh of ________ after hearing that her brother was not injured in the accident.
Research suggests that people with outgoing personalities tend to be more ________, often expecting that good things will happen.
No one could beat Paul at running. He has won the running championship ________ for three years.
If you fly from Taipei to Tokyo, you’ll be taking an international, rather than a ________ flight.
Jack is very proud of his fancy new motorcycle. He has been ________ to all his friends about how cool it looks and how fast it runs.
The ideas about family have changed ________ in the past twenty years. For example, my grandfather was one of ten children in his family, but I am the only child.
The chairperson of the meeting asked everyone to speak up instead of ________ their opinions among themselves.
Although Mr. Chen is rich, he is a very ________ person and is never willing to spend any money to help those who are in need.
If you want to know what your dreams mean, now there are websites you can visit to help you ________ them.
The memory ________ of the new computer has been increased so that more information can be stored.
With his excellent social skills, Steven has been ________ as a great communicator by all his colleagues.
When you enter a building, be sure to look behind you and hold the door open for someone coming through the same door. It is a common ________ in many cultures.
The telephone has changed beyond ________ in recent years. In both form and function, it has become totally different from what it was before.
Though Jack has moved out of his parents’ house, he is ________ dependent on them still. They send him a check every month for his living expenses.
If you want to keep your computer from being attacked by new viruses, you need to constantly renew and ________ your anti-virus software.
Many factors may explain why people are addicted to the Internet. One factor ________ to this phenomenon is the easy access to the Net.
We were ________ awaiting the results of the school’s annual English drama contest. Our class won the first place last year, and we certainly wanted to win again this year.
Tropical rainforests are home to about one million plant and animal species. If the rainforests disappear, many of these species will become ________.
An honest person is faithful to his promise. Once he makes a ________, he will not go back on his own word.
The new computer game Wii provides us with an ________ way of exercising. People now may play sports in their living rooms, which was unimaginable before.
All the new students were given one minute to ________ introduce themselves to the whole class.
His dark brown jacket had holes in the elbows and had ________ to light brown, but he continued to wear it.
Everyone in our company enjoys working with Jason. He’s got all the qualities that make a ________ partner.
Eyes are sensitive to light. Looking at the sun ________ could damage our eyes.
We were forced to ________ our plan for the weekend picnic because of the bad weather.
Three people are running for mayor. All three ________ seem confident that they will be elected, but we won’t know until the outcome of the election is announced.
If you ________ a traffic law, such as drinking and driving, you may not drive for some time.
Applying to college means sending in applications, writing study plans, and so on. It’s a long ________, and it makes students nervous.
Dr. Chu’s speech on the new energy source attracted great ________ from the audience at the conference.
Everyone in the office must attend the meeting tomorrow. There are no ________ allowed.
To make fresh lemonade, cut the lemon in half, ________ the juice into a bowl, and then add as much water and sugar as you like.
Steve has several meetings to attend every day; therefore, he has to work on a very ________ schedule.
Michael Phelps, an American swimmer, broke seven world records and won eight gold medals in men’s swimming ________ in the 2008 Olympics.
Those college students work at the orphanage on a ________ basis, helping the children with their studies without receiving any pay.
Studies show that asking children to do house ________, such as taking out the trash or doing the dishes, helps them grow into responsible adults.
John has been scolded by his boss for over ten minutes now. ________, she is not happy about his being late again.
Since the orange trees suffered ________ damage from a storm in the summer, the farmers are expecting a sharp decline in harvests this winter.
Typhoon Morakot claimed more than six hundred lives in early August of 2009, making it the most serious natural ________ in Taiwan in recent decades.
Robert was the only ________ to the car accident. The police had to count on him to find out exactly how the accident happened.
Badly injured in the car accident, Jason could ________ move his legs and was sent to the hospital right away.
Steve’s description of the place was so ________ that I could almost picture it in my mind.
When people feel uncomfortable or nervous, they may ________ their arms across their chests as if to protect themselves.
The doors of these department stores slide open ________ when you approach them. You don’t have to open them yourself.
Nicole is a ________ language learner. Within a short period of time, she has developed a good command of Chinese and Japanese.
With rising oil prices, there is an increasing ________ for people to ride bicycles to work.
This information came from a very ________ source, so you don’t have to worry about being cheated.
We hope that there will be no war in the world and that all people live in peace and ________ with each other.
To have a full discussion of the issue, the committee spent a whole hour ________ their ideas at the meeting.
While adapting to western ways of living, many Asian immigrants in the US still try hard to ________ their own cultures and traditions.
With the worsening of global economic conditions, it seems wiser and more ________ to keep cash in the bank rather than to invest in the stock market.
Under the ________ of newly elected president Barack Obama, the US is expected to turn a new page in politics and economy.
Rapid advancement in motor engineering makes it ________ possible to build a flying car in the near future.
When you take photos, you can move around to shoot the target object from different ________.
Students were asked to ________ or rewrite their compositions based on the teacher’s comments.
Besides lung cancer, another ________ of smoking is wrinkles, a premature sign of aging.
Amy did not ________ changes in the course schedule and therefore missed the class.
It is not easy for old people to ________ their backs, so they need help when their backs itch.
Mary is suffering from a stomachache and needs to eat food which is easy to ________.
Since our classroom is not air-conditioned, we have to ________ the heat during the hot summer days.
Sue is so ________ that she always breaks something when she is shopping at a store.
Ann enjoyed going to the flower market. She believed that the ________ of flowers refreshed her mind.
